name: 林逾先
objective: This course teaches students the estimations of time and cost when managing a project, the development of project schedule and budget, and other relevant skills in monitoring and controlling the project. The development of project proposal, feasibility study of project investment, project risk assessment, project interface management, and the role of project manager in a project team within an organization will also be discussed.
schedule:
1　　Introduction (course outlines and class teaching notes)
2     　　Concept and definition of “project” with its applications
3   　　Project manager and project team; Project proposal 
4     　　Project investment feasibility and selection criteria
5    　　Project scheduling based on Gantt chart; Project network representation
6     　　Project scheduling based on AOA and AON network;
　　Identification of critical path(s)
7     　　Project scheduling based on matrix; Identification of critical path(s) through
        activity adjacency matrix
8     　　Budgeting and cost control of a project
9     　　Mid-term exam
10     Project risk assessment and monitoring
11     Instructor out of the country on business (No class) 
12     Project interface management
13   　　 Project scheduling with constrained resource
14   　　 Project resource leveling
15     Project time and cost tradeoffs
16　　 Estimation of activity time and the probability of project completion within a time
         frame
17　　Class presentation
18　　Class presentation
scorePolicy:
Class attendance　　    15%
Individual assignment    20%
Mid-term exam　　            40%
Class presentation　　    25%

Project Management, by Edward Lin, Taipei University of Technology, September 2014

Effective Project Management (4nd Edition), by Clements and Gido
